description.value:
Totem of Wendigo

Totem Spirit (War) — Creation Cost: 9 Gnosis

Spirit Aspect: Endurance / Cold Resolve / Survival

Recommended Umbra Spirits (CR 8+)

To bind Wendigo, the pack must confront a spirit of relentless cold, hunger, and survival through deprivation. Suitable spirits include:

  • Elder Ice-Hunger Spirit (Wendigo Aspect) — Suggested base: Frost Giant Everlasting One–style spirit (CR 12–13), reflavored as an Umbra predator of winter and starvation
  • Glacial Devourer Spirit — Suggested base: Remorhaz or Frost Salamander–style stat block (CR 11–12), stripped of elemental typing and treated as a spirit of consumption
  • Endless Blizzard Spirit — Suggested base: Air or Water Elemental Myrmidon (CR 7) empowered to CR 8+, with cold damage and exhaustion effects

These spirits do not bargain kindly. Worth is proven through endurance, sacrifice, or survival under extreme hardship.

Individual Trait

The creature who touches the Totem gains the following benefit until the next long rest:

  • You gain resistance to cold damage
  • You have advantage on saving throws against exhaustion
  • When you would gain a level of exhaustion, you may ignore that level once per long rest

Only one creature may benefit from this trait at a time.

Pack Trait

As an action, a creature touching the Totem may invoke Wendigo's resolve.

For 1 minute, while within 20 feet of the Totem:

  • Pack members gain resistance to cold damage
  • Pack members have advantage on Constitution saving throws
  • Once during the duration, when a pack member would drop to 0 hit points, they may instead drop to 1 hit point and gain one level of exhaustion instead

This reflects Wendigo's creed: survive now, pay later.

Ban — Survival Is Earned

Wendigo demands strength through hardship.

The pack must not waste vital resources, abandon preparation, or seek comfort when hardship can be endured, if survival is reasonably possible.

If the pack repeatedly chooses ease over endurance or refuses to suffer when necessary, the Totem becomes dormant and all its benefits cease.

To restore the Totem, the pack leader must reinvest the required Gnosis cost to reaffirm the bond.

If the pack repeatedly or egregiously violates this Ban, Wendigo may withdraw entirely, permanently severing itself from the Totem at the Storyteller's discretion.

Totem rules: Only one Totem per pack; benefits do not stack; a dormant Totem provides no benefits. Once a Totem benefit is used, it cannot be used again until after a long rest. Interacting with a Totem requires 1 action while touching it; choose either the Individual Trait or the Pack Trait.
